Reviews.Title: “near public transport”
Reviews.Author: zogia
Reviews.Content: good location near the metro station.The breakfast was not included in the price of the room.Helpful staff at the reception.The room was ok in general except the safe locker that was damaged and the walls and curtains that were dirty from the smoke of the cigarettes.clean bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Central”
Reviews.Author: Pasqualy79
Reviews.Content: Very close to the centre of Madrid and a very short walk from all public transport. The room was ok, the bathroom was great. Shame about the roadworks opposite and the fact that the staff were not very helpful or friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable location in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Scoutuk
Reviews.Content: As a travel writer, I attend the FITUR tourism exhibition every January. The Caballero Errante, while certainly not luxurious, is spotlessly clean, very good value for this part of town and is very close to the metro. It has the benefit of having one of the best restaurants in Madrid directly across the street as well as a very adequate family run restaurant almost next door. It's very rare for breakfast to be included in Spanish hotels, but I would almost never have breakfast in a hotel. There are loads of little cafes nearby where you can join the Spanish for a coffee with toast, olive oil and tomato for around €2

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: jamsie65
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here two nights on the tail end of a trip to Madrid and the surrounding region. The room was the most impressive - very clean, cheerful and quiet. Downsides:there was no breakfast included in the price, the staff do not always speak English (was ok as I have some Spanish), they forgot to call me in the morning as requested, the location is so-so (not that pretty, but fine for 2 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Caballero Errante”
Reviews.Author: sangeeta298
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located very near to a metro station called Valdeacederas of Line 1. The station is at Murillo road. Just follow the street Via Pinos Alta to reach the hotel. We booked a double bedroom for 53 euros in this hotel (in July 2007). Breakfast was not included in this but was available for additional 7 euros. Our room was quite small though it was beautifully decorated with pink colour and floral prints. It had a tiny bath with very little scope for moving our hand around. The locker was not working in our room. The air conditioning was very good. The receptionists knew english but they could not help us with our queries about metro and tourist spots in madrid. They also donot keep a madrid map for their guests. There is a general store very close by with resonable prices - around half of what we are generally charged at tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights based on a review we read on this site. When we received the key to our room we were suprised to see 2 twin beds (attached to the wall), instead of the double bed we booked. Not very romantic, and the desk clerk didn't seem to care. Overall, the hotel is okay if you are looking for a cheap, clean bed, but don't expect more more than that. Here are our thoughts: PROS: -Very clean and newly renovated hotel -Large room by Euro-standards -Quick walk to the Metro to get downtown -Air Conditioning works well (It was HOT during our stay) CONS: - Out of the way of tourist attractions and good restaurants. The neighborhood had some good local places for Bocadillos and Churros con Chocolate, but not much else. -Very uninterested desk staff; not pleasant but not rude either - just there -Sub par breakfast (cold eggs / meats, juices and yogurts were warm, not much fruit)
